main event: An emergency sighting of a shiny bell-shaped object traveling from west to east in the southern horizon, as reported in an official document by the Department of the Air Force.
interesting points: The object appeared to be traveling from west to east along the horizon and then disappeared over the horizon.
Duration of observation was 45 minutes, during which the object's magnetic heading, altitude, and speed were noted.
The altitude of the object was described as quite brilliant, possibly leaving a clear trail of illumination.
Instructions were provided for distributing the sighting information to various military and government agencies, indicating the seriousness of the report.
The document does not confirm the presence of any photographs of the observed object.
witnesses: Department of the Air Force personnel
